descript.abstract: Assessors parcel data for Town/City of BURLINGTON. Developed from existing digital data. Geometry and attribute data updated January 2021

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.
idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.
idinfo.datacred: Original map compilation unknown. Data maintenance performed by Michael Parkin. MassGIS Level 3 compliance obtained by Cartographic Associates, Inc. and by Applied Geographics, Inc.

citeinfo.title: Parcel data for BURLINGTON, MA complying with Level 3 of MassGIS digital parcel standard

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public rights-of-way (ROWs) exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

Total number of parcels in M048TaxPar = 7652 Total number of assessor records in M048Assess = 8326 (number of assessor records found where LOC_ID is NULL: 1)
HIGHER VALUE PROPERTY --------------------- Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8% Number of assessor records identified where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 7837 Minimum number of these 7837 records that must link to parcels to pass QA: 7822 Actual number of these 7837 records that link to tax parcels: 7837 Observed match rate for assessor records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 100.00% High value match rate passes QA.
LOWER VALUE PROPERTY -------------------- Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0% Number of assessor records identified where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 489 Minimum number of these 489 records that must link to parcels to pass QA: 475 Actual number of these 489 records that link to tax parcels: 488 Observed match rate for assessor records where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 99.80% Low value match rate passes QA.
# Checking match rate of parcels to assessor list... =========================================================================== Required match rate for 7652 parcels: 99.0% Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 7641 Minimum number of these 7641 parcels that must link to assessor records to pass QA: 7565 Actual number of these 7641 parcels that link to assessor records: 7637 Observed match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.95% Parcel to assessor match rate passes QA.

horizpa.horizpar: Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

srcinfo.srccontr: This GIS dataset represents a digital version of assessor tax maps that were previously converted and processed into a geodatbase/shapefile format from AutoCAD.

procstep.procdesc: Parcel polygons and water, wetland and ROW lines converted with ESRI tools to project, dissolve, copy, calculate, and generally manipulate the ESRI version of the data to meet Mass GIS Level III standards. The source data is not changed by this process.

Updated parcel data which had fallen out of Level III compliance was conformed using previously conformed data. Parcel data was brought into the Level III schema; LOC_IDs were brought in from previously conformed data for parcels that were not edited; LOC_IDs were calculated for updated parcels; Additionally boundary parcels were adjusted to match survey boundary

Updated parcel data which had fallen out of Level III compliance was conformed using previously conformed data. Parcel data was brought into the Level III schema; LOC_IDs were brought in from previously conformed data for parcels that were not edited; LOC_IDs were calculated for updated parcels; Additionally boundary parcels were adjusted to match survey boundary

Updated parcel data which had fallen out of Level III compliance was conformed using previously conformed data. Parcel data was brought into the Level III schema; LOC_IDs were brought in from previously conformed data for parcels that were not edited; LOC_IDs were calculated for updated parcels; Additionally boundary parcels were adjusted to match survey boundary

overview.dsoverv: M048TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of BURLINGTON that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M048Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M048OthLeg and M048Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http:/ /www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.
overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1.
http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/standards/standard-parcels.html

report.measDesc: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public rights-of-way (ROWs) exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

Total number of parcels in M048TaxPar = 7652 Total number of assessor records in M048Assess = 8326 (number of assessor records found where LOC_ID is NULL: 1) HIGHER VALUE PROPERTY --------------------- Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8% Number of assessor records identified where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 7837 Minimum number of these 7837 records that must link to parcels to pass QA: 7822 Actual number of these 7837 records that link to tax parcels: 7837 Observed match rate for assessor records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 100.00% High value match rate passes QA. LOWER VALUE PROPERTY -------------------- Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0% Number of assessor records identified where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 489 Minimum number of these 489 records that must link to parcels to pass QA: 475 Actual number of these 489 records that link to tax parcels: 488 Observed match rate for assessor records where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 99.80% Low value match rate passes QA. # Checking match rate of parcels to assessor list... =========================================================================== Required match rate for 7652 parcels: 99.0% Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 7641 Minimum number of these 7641 parcels that must link to assessor records to pass QA: 7565 Actual number of these 7641 parcels that link to assessor records: 7637 Observed match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.95% Parcel to assessor match rate passes QA.

Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

prcStep.stepDesc: Parcel polygons and water, wetland and ROW lines converted with ESRI tools to project, dissolve, copy, calculate, and generally manipulate the ESRI version of the data to meet Mass GIS Level III standards. The source data is not changed by this process.

Updated parcel data which had fallen out of Level III compliance was conformed using previously conformed data. Parcel data was brought into the Level III schema; LOC_IDs were brought in from previously conformed data for parcels that were not edited; LOC_IDs were calculated for updated parcels; Additionally boundary parcels were adjusted to match survey boundary

Updated parcel data which had fallen out of Level III compliance was conformed using previously conformed data.
